text: Differential cytokine regulation by NF-kappaB and AP-1 in Jurkat T-cells
Activator protein ( AP ) -1 and nuclear factor ( NF ) - kappaB largely control T-cell activation , following binding of foreign antigens to the T-cell receptor leading to cytokine secretion .

Elevated levels of pro-inflammatory cytokines and chemokines such as TNF , <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> CXCL8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> are associated with several human diseases including cystic fibrosis , pulmonary fibrosis and AIDS .

The aim of this study was to investigate the role of the transcription factors , AP-1 and NF-kappaB , in <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> CXCL8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> regulation in Jurkat T-cells .

text: Phorbol myristate acetate ( PMA ) exposure resulted in an up-regulation of AP-1 and down-regulation of NF-kappaB activity , however , exposure to heat killed ( HK ) Escherichia .
coli MG1655 resulted in a dose - dependent increase in NF-kappaB activity without affecting AP-1 .

The cytokine profile revealed an up-regulation of the chemokine <extra_id_0> CXCL8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and the pro-inflammatory cytokines TNF , <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> following treatment with both PMA and HK E . coli , while the levels of the anti-inflammatory cytokine <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> were not affected by PMA but were significantly down-regulated by HK E . coli .

text: AP-1 activation was significantly increased 2 h after PMA exposure and continued to increase thereafter .
In contrast , NF-kappaB responded to PMA exposure by a rapid up-regulation followed by a subsequent down-regulation .

Increased intracellular Ca2+ concentrations countered the down-regulation of NF-kappaB by PMA , while similar treatment with calcium ionophore resulted in a reduced NF-kappaB activity following induction with HK E . coli .
In order to further study NF-kappaB activation , we considered two up - stream signalling proteins , PKC and <extra_id_0> Bcl10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
Phosphorylated - PKC levels increased in response to PMA and HK E . coli , while <extra_id_0> Bcl10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> levels significantly decreased following PMA treatment .

Using an NF-kappaB activation inhibitor , we observed complete inhibition of <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression while <extra_id_0> CXCL8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> levels only decreased by 40 % at the highest concentration .

text: This complex regulation of <extra_id_0> CXCL8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> suggests that there is a need to further evaluate the signalling pathways in order to develop new treatment for diseases with elevated <extra_id_0> CXCL8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> levels , such as AIDS and autoimmune diseases .
